Articles.Content:
That looks sooooooo cool. I can't wait to get my little paws on it It's nice also that you have the Altair cargo deck, becuase IIRC It's the core stage of the Mars Landers also and doubles as a crew return craft as it flies back to MTV.

I find it awesome tinged with a little sadness that we're actually building equipment as a community to do stuff that NASA never got to do because of budget cuts and a short-sighted government :\

Edited June 9, 2013 by MDBenson

YES... You know you should make a video of KSP going to duna don't you... Send it to NASA and they will be going green with envy.

God, I sooooooo want Altair you know. Oh and that rover, Bobcat... Stick a couple of headless Kerbals on the back (ie just empty suits heh. When you EVA the kerbal appears inside the suit.

Oh yeah Bobcat... Will you be making multiple versions of Altair and Orion? Like these?

Edited June 10, 2013 by NeoMorph
Or make a seat module like the stock one that does it!

YES... You know you should make a video of KSP going to duna don't you... Send it to NASA and they will be going green with envy.

God, I sooooooo want Altair you know. Oh and that rover, Bobcat... Stick a couple of headless Kerbals on the back (ie just empty suits heh. When you EVA the kerbal appears inside the suit.

Oh yeah Bobcat... Will you be making multiple versions of Altair and Orion? Like these?

This one is the orion with the SLS second stage attached to it. It is not part of constellation, it is part of SLS and BobCat said a few posts back that he will not do the SLS.

@BobCat

The LER looks really good with visible internals and Kerbals inside, and it's awesome that you're implementing the 90Ã‚Â°-rotating wheels! This may turn out to be the best BobCat rover yet.

Here's a good, short

that showcases a lot of the features of the LER and has some decent interior shots.
Yep. Real shame dont read what im write.

Do you plan to make the hatch dockable? That would be pretty cool though you'd probably have to get pretty creative with any base stuff you'd have it dock to. I, at least, don't know of any Lunar base plans that got past a conceptual stage.

EDIT: I suppose it would be easy enough for you to make a LER-style docking-hatch module for use with HOME2 when you pick that up again. That could be pretty cool!

Edited June 10, 2013 by Yasutaka
Anyone know how to remove the auto fairing on the J2-X? I want to use it for other rockets that don't need the fairing. Thanks

.cfg edit

delete zhese 2 :

MODULE

{

name = ModuleJettison

jettisonName = Orion5_shroud

bottomNodeName = bottom

isFairing = True

jettisonedObjectMass = 0.5

jettisonForce = 40

jettisonDirection = 0 1 0

}

MODULE

{

name = ModuleJettison

jettisonName = Orion6_shroud

bottomNodeName = bottom

isFairing = True

jettisonedObjectMass = 0.5

jettisonForce = 40

jettisonDirection = 0 1 0

}
I still can't get the Klipper to not flip out of control even with removal of toggleadvasas removed, and the configs updated to reflect that.
Now dockports work fine. You can build Mun outpost.

Just one thing to say on this auspicious occasion....

Please give! It looks toasty and delicious!
It looks great bobcat, ISS, MUN ADDITION, technically it wouldn't be ISS though, it would be IMS! (International Munar Station)
Beautiful!

I still can't get the Klipper to not flip out of control even with removal of toggleadvasas removed, and the configs updated to reflect that.

I actually figured this out. Strut the Kliper to the payload base. For some reason the nosecone makes things ever so slightly wobbly, which causes a cascade effect. So you either run without the nosecone, or strut the Kliper.
stop teasing Bobcat!

I actually figured this out. Strut the Kliper to the payload base. For some reason the nosecone makes things ever so slightly wobbly, which causes a cascade effect. So you either run without the nosecone, or strut the Kliper.

Thanks Ill give it a try and let you know if it works
bobcat your the man!! its looking real good.

I actually figured this out. Strut the Kliper to the payload base. For some reason the nosecone makes things ever so slightly wobbly, which causes a cascade effect. So you either run without the nosecone, or strut the Kliper.

Like I said in the other post I'd let you know.

It fixed it for me, thanks!
